title: Part (a)(i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate algae or seaweed.

title: Part (a)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response can earn a point for this part even if it did not earn a point in (a)(i).
descriptions: The response does not indicate common seal or herring gull.
The response indicates common seal or herring gull.

title: Part (a)(iii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response can earn a point for this part even if it did not earn a point in (a)(i) or (a)(ii). The response must list both organism in the pair to earn the point.
descriptions: The response does not identify one of the following groups of two organisms that compete for the same food source.
The response identifies one of the following groups of two organisms that compete for the same food source.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response must describe, not just identify, the process of primary productivity.
descriptions: The response does not describe primary productivity in any of the following ways.
The response describes primary productivity in one of the following ways.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response describes, not just identifies, one short-term direct effect of overharvesting crab on the food web shown.
descriptions: The response does not provide one of the following descriptions of a short-term direct effect.
The response provides one of the following descriptions of a short-term direct effect.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response describes, not just identifies, one potential realistic strategy to increase the population of crabs. The response cannot describe banning harvest of all crabs.
descriptions:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response describes, not just identifies, one potential realistic strategy to increase the population of crabs. The response cannot describe banning harvest of all crabs.
The response provides any of the following descriptions of a potential realistic strategy to increase the population of crabs.
